data.title: How to Enjoy a Magical Day at Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park
meta_keywords: best time to visit Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park
Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park opening hours
Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park entry fee
data.meta_description: A comprehensive guide to one of the most popular attractions in Malaysia’s capital city
data.text:
Are you looking for a fun and educational way to spend a day in Kuala Lumpur? Do you love nature and wildlife? Do you want to see thousands of colorful butterflies flying around you? If you answered yes to any of these questions, then you should definitely visit Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park.

This park is home to over 5,000 butterflies from 120 different species, as well as a variety of other insects, plants, and animals. It is a must-see attraction for anyone who loves nature and wants to experience a magical and memorable day in Kuala Lumpur. In this article, we will tell you everything you need to know about Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park, including how to get there, when to go, how to book tickets, what to expect, and what to do after your visit. Read on to find out more!

What is Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park and Why You Should Visit It

Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park is a large and beautiful park that covers an area of 80,000 square feet. It was established in 1991 and is one of the largest butterfly parks in the world. The park is designed to mimic the natural habitat of the butterflies, with lush greenery, flowers, ponds, waterfalls, and bridges. The park also features a museum, a nursery, a breeding area, and a souvenir shop.

The main attraction of the park is, of course, the butterflies. You can see thousands of them flying freely around you, landing on your clothes, hair, or hands. You can admire their stunning colors, patterns, and shapes, and learn about their life cycle and behavior. You can also spot some rare and exotic species, such as the Rajah Brooke’s Birdwing, the Malayan Birdwing, and the Golden Birdwing.

But the park is not only about butterflies. You can also see and learn about other insects, such as beetles, scorpions, spiders, and ants. You can visit the museum, where you can see over 4,000 specimens of insects and butterflies from all over the world. You can also visit the nursery, where you can see how the butterflies are bred and raised. You can also visit the souvenir shop, where you can buy some unique and beautiful gifts, such as butterfly-themed jewelry, accessories, and crafts.

Visiting Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park is a great way to enjoy and appreciate the beauty and diversity of nature. It is also a fun and educational activity for people of all ages and backgrounds. You can learn a lot about the butterflies and their environment, and also have a relaxing and enjoyable time. It is a perfect place to visit with your family, friends, or partner, and create some unforgettable memories.

How to Get to Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park and Where to Park Your Car

Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park is located in the heart of the city, within the Lake Gardens area. It is close to some other popular attractions, such as the Bird Park, the Orchid Garden, the National Mosque, and the Islamic Arts Museum. The address and contact details of the park are:

Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park Jalan Cenderasari, Tasik Perdana, 50480 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia Tel: +60 3-2693 4799

Email: klbutterflypark@yahoo.com Website: www.klbutterflypark.com

There are several ways to get to the park from different points in the city, such as the airport, the train station, the bus terminal, etc. Here are some of the options:

By car:

If you are driving, you can use the GPS or Google Maps to find the best route to the park. The park is about 60 km from the Kuala Lumpur International Airport (KLIA), and it takes about an hour to get there by car. The park is about 5 km from the Kuala Lumpur Sentral Station, and it takes about 15 minutes to get there by car. The park has a parking lot where you can park your car for a fee of RM 2 per hour. The parking lot is open from 8 am to 6 pm daily. You can also find some street parking nearby, but be careful of the traffic and the parking rules.

By train:

If you are taking the train, you can take the KTM Komuter line to the Kuala Lumpur Station, which is about 1 km from the park. You can walk or take a taxi from there. You can also take the LRT line to the Pasar Seni Station, which is about 2 km from the park. You can walk or take a taxi from there. The train fare depends on the distance and the type of train, but it is usually around RM 2 to RM 10 per person. The train service is available from 6 am to 11 pm daily.

By bus:

If you are taking the bus, you can take the RapidKL bus number B115, which stops at the park’s entrance. You can also take the Hop-On Hop-Off bus, which is a tourist-friendly bus that covers many attractions in the city. You can get off at stop number 14, which is near the park. The bus fare depends on the distance and the type of bus, but it is usually around RM 1 to RM 5 per person. The bus service is available from 6 am to 11 pm daily.

When to Visit Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park and How Long to Stay There

Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park is open every day from 9 am to 6 pm, except on public holidays. The park may also close temporarily due to bad weather, maintenance, or other reasons. You can check the park’s website or call the park’s office to confirm the opening hours and days before your visit.

The best time to visit the park is in the morning, when the weather is cooler and the butterflies are more active. You can also avoid the crowd and enjoy the park more peacefully. The park is usually more crowded and hotter in the afternoon, especially on weekends and school holidays. You can also visit the park during the rainy season, as the park has a covered walkway and a sheltered area where you can still see the butterflies.

You can stay at the park as long as you want, but we recommend spending at least two hours to explore and enjoy the park fully. You can follow this sample itinerary or plan your own visit according to your interests and preferences:

9 am: Arrive at the park and buy your tickets at the counter. You can also book your tickets online or through a tour operator to save time and money.

9:15 am: Enter the park and start your adventure. Follow the signs and the map to see the different sections and attractions of the park. You can also join a guided tour or a workshop to learn more about the butterflies and their environment.

10:15 am: Visit the museum, where you can see over 4,000 specimens of insects and butterflies from all over the world. You can also see some live insects, such as beetles, scorpions, spiders, and ants. You can also visit the nursery, where you can see how the butterflies are bred and raised.

11:15 am: Visit the souvenir shop, where you can buy some unique and beautiful gifts, such as butterfly-themed jewelry, accessories, and crafts. You can also take some photos and videos of the park and the butterflies, and share them on your social media.

12 pm: Exit the park and continue your journey. You can visit some other attractions and landmarks that are close to the park, such as the Bird Park, the Orchid Garden, the National Mosque, and the Islamic Arts Museum. You can also find some places to eat and drink near the park, such as restaurants, cafes, or street food stalls.

How to Book Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park Tickets and How Much They Cost

The ticket prices for Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park are as follows:

Adult: RM 25

Child (2-11 years old): RM 14

Senior citizen (60 years and above): RM 14

Student (with valid ID): RM 14

Disabled (with valid ID): RM 14

The tickets include the entrance fee and the access to all the sections and attractions of the park. The tickets do not include the parking fee, the guided tour fee, the workshop fee, or the souvenir shop purchases.

Here are some tips and tricks to save money or get the best deals on your tickets:

Book your tickets online and in advance, as you can get some discounts or deals on your tickets, such as 10% off, buy one get one free, or free cancellation.

Book your tickets in bulk or as a group, as you can get some discounts or deals on your tickets, such as 20% off, free entry for children, or free souvenirs.

Book your tickets with a combo or a package, as you can get some discounts or deals on your tickets, as well as access to other attractions or services, such as the Bird Park, the Orchid Garden, the National Mosque, the Islamic Arts Museum, transportation, insurance, or food.

Use coupons, vouchers, or promo codes, as you can get some discounts or deals on your tickets, such as 5% off, free upgrade, or free gift.

Visit the park during the off-peak season or time, as you can get some discounts or deals on your tickets, as well as avoid the crowd and enjoy the park more peacefully.

What to Expect and How to Enjoy Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park

Visiting Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park is a wonderful and unforgettable experience that you will cherish for a long time. Here are some things that you can expect and do to enjoy the park to the fullest:

- Enter the park and start your adventure. Follow the signs and the map to see the different sections and attractions of the park. You can also join a guided tour or a workshop to learn more about the butterflies and their environment. The guided tour is available every hour from 10 am to 4 pm, and costs RM 10 per person. The workshop is available on request, and costs RM 20 per person. You can book the tour or the workshop at the counter or online.

- Walk along the covered walkway and enter the butterfly enclosure, where you can see thousands of butterflies flying freely around you. You can admire their stunning colors, patterns, and shapes, and learn about their life cycle and behavior. You can also spot some rare and exotic species, such as the Rajah Brooke’s Birdwing, the Malayan Birdwing, and the Golden Birdwing. You can also feed the butterflies with some fruits or nectar that are provided by the park staff. You can also touch the butterflies gently, but be careful not to harm them or disturb their wings.

- Explore the landscaped gardens, where you can see a variety of plants, flowers, ponds, waterfalls, and bridges. You can enjoy the natural beauty and tranquility of the park, and listen to the sounds of the birds, insects, and water. You can also see some other animals, such as turtles, fish, frogs, and lizards. You can also relax and rest on the benches or the gazebos that are scattered around the park.

- Visit the museum, where you can see over 4,000 specimens of insects and butterflies from all over the world. You can also see some live insects, such as beetles, scorpions, spiders, and ants. You can learn about the classification, anatomy, and ecology of the insects and butterflies, and see some interesting and rare exhibits, such as the world’s largest butterfly, the world’s smallest butterfly, and the world’s most poisonous insect.

- Visit the nursery, where you can see how the butterflies are bred and raised. You can see the different stages of the butterfly’s life cycle, from the egg, to the caterpillar, to the pupa, to the adult. You can also see how the park staff take care of the butterflies, and how they control the temperature, humidity, and light of the nursery. You can also see some of the equipment and tools that are used for the breeding and raising of the butterflies.

- Visit the souvenir shop, where you can buy some unique and beautiful gifts, such as butterfly-themed jewelry, accessories, and crafts. You can also buy some books, posters, stickers, and magnets that feature the butterflies and the park. You can also buy some live butterflies or pupae that you can take home and release in your garden. You can also take some photos and videos of the park and the butterflies, and share them on your social media.

Dos and don’ts, safety measures, and recommendations for the visitors

1. Do wear comfortable and light clothing and shoes, as the park can be hot and humid. You can also bring a hat, sunglasses, and sunscreen to protect yourself from the sun.

2. Do bring a camera, a phone, or a video recorder to capture the beauty and the memories of the park and the butterflies. You can also bring a binocular, a magnifying glass, or a guidebook to see and learn more about the butterflies and their environment.

3. Do respect the park rules and regulations, such as not smoking, littering, or feeding the animals. You can also follow the instructions and advice of the park staff and the guides, who are there to help you and ensure your safety and enjoyment.

4. Do ask questions and interact with the park staff and the guides, who are friendly and knowledgeable. You can also join the guided tour or the workshop to learn more about the butterflies and their environment.

5. Don’t touch or disturb the butterflies or the plants, unless you are allowed or instructed to do so. You can also avoid wearing bright colors, perfumes, or insect repellents, as they may attract or repel the butterflies. You can also avoid making loud noises or sudden movements, as they may scare or harm the butterflies.

6. Don’t bring any food or drinks into the park, except for water. You can also avoid eating or drinking near the butterflies or the plants, as they may contaminate or damage them. You can also avoid bringing any pets or animals into the park, as they may pose a threat or a nuisance to the butterflies or the other visitors.

Here are some fun facts, interesting stories, or helpful tips about the park, the butterflies, or the surrounding area, that can enhance your knowledge and enjoyment of the park:

The park has a collection of over 15,000 live butterflies, which are replenished every month from the nursery or from the local breeders. The park also has a collection of over 6,000 preserved butterflies, which are displayed in the museum or sold in the souvenir shop.

The park is a member of the International Association of Butterfly Exhibitors and Suppliers (IABES), which is a global network of butterfly parks, farms, and suppliers. The park also participates in some conservation and research projects, such as the Butterfly Conservation Project, the Butterfly Monitoring Scheme, and the Butterfly Identification Guide.

The park is located in the Lake Gardens area, which is one of the oldest and most scenic parks in Kuala Lumpur. The area was originally a tin mining site, but was later transformed into a botanical garden by the British colonial government in the 1880s. The area now hosts some of the most popular attractions in the city, such as the Bird Park, the Orchid Garden, the National Mosque, and the Islamic Arts Museum.

The park is named after the city of Kuala Lumpur, which means “muddy confluence” in Malay. The name refers to the location of the city, which is at the confluence of two rivers, the Klang and the Gombak. The city is also known as the “Garden City of Lights”, because of its greenery and its nightlife.

What to Do and Where to Go After Visiting Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park

After visiting Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park, you can continue your journey and explore some other attractions and landmarks that are close to the park, such as:

The Bird Park, which is the world’s largest free-flight walk-in aviary, where you can see over 3,000 birds from 200 different species, such as flamingos, peacocks, hornbills, and parrots. You can also enjoy some shows, activities, and exhibits, such as the Bird Show, the Feeding Time, and the Education Station.

The Orchid Garden, which is a beautiful and fragrant garden that showcases over 800 varieties of orchids, such as the Vanda, the Dendrobium, and the Cattleya. You can also see some other flowers, such as the hibiscus, the jasmine, and the bougainvillea. You can also buy some plants, seeds, or souvenirs at the garden’s shop.

The National Mosque, which is a stunning and symbolic mosque that represents the Islamic culture and heritage of Malaysia. You can admire the architecture, the design, and the decoration of the mosque, such as the blue dome, the minaret, and the calligraphy. You can also learn about the history, the rituals, and the values of the mosque, and join the prayers if you wish.

The Islamic Arts Museum, which is the largest museum of Islamic art in Southeast Asia, where you can see over 7,000 artifacts and artworks from various Islamic civilizations, such as the Ottoman, the Mughal, and the Safavid. You can also see some exhibits, such as the Quran and Manuscript Gallery, the Architecture Gallery, and the Jewelry Gallery.

You can also find some places to eat and drink near the park, such as:

The Hornbill Restaurant and Cafe, which is a cozy and charming restaurant and cafe that is located inside the Bird Park. You can enjoy some delicious and authentic Malaysian and Western dishes, such as the nasi lemak, the chicken curry, and the fish and chips. You can also enjoy some refreshing and exotic drinks, such as the coconut water, the mango juice, and the coffee. You can also enjoy the view of the birds and the park from the restaurant’s windows or terrace.

The Lake Garden Cafe, which is a casual and friendly cafe that is located near the park’s entrance. You can enjoy some simple and tasty snacks and beverages, such as the sandwiches, the cakes, and the tea. You can also enjoy the view of the lake and the garden from the cafe’s tables or chairs.

The Old Town White Coffee, which is a popular and modern cafe that is located near the Pasar Seni Station. You can enjoy some classic and contemporary Malaysian and Chinese dishes, such as the nasi kandar, the char kway teow, and the laksa. You can also enjoy some smooth and aromatic coffee, such as the white coffee, the black coffee, and the iced coffee. You can also enjoy the ambiance and the service of the cafe, which is cozy and efficient.

Places to Stay Near The Park

You can also find some places to stay near the park, such as:

The Hilton Kuala Lumpur, which is a luxurious and elegant hotel that is located near the Kuala Lumpur Sentral Station. You can enjoy some spacious and comfortable rooms and suites, which are equipped with modern amenities and facilities, such as the air-conditioning, the Wi-Fi, and the TV. You can also enjoy some superb and diverse dining options, such as the Vasco’s, the Graze, and the Iketeru. You can also enjoy some relaxing and rejuvenating services, such as the spa, the pool, and the gym.

The Majestic Hotel Kuala Lumpur, which is a historic and charming hotel that is located near the Kuala Lumpur Station. You can enjoy some stylish and cozy rooms and suites, which are decorated with colonial and art deco themes, and feature some antique and vintage furniture and accessories. You can also enjoy some exquisite and authentic dining options, such as the Contango, the Colonial Cafe, and the Tea Lounge. You can also enjoy some splendid and memorable services, such as the cinema, the library, and the orchid conservatory.

The Travel Hub Guesthouse, which is a budget and friendly guesthouse that is located near the Pasar Seni Station. You can enjoy some clean and simple rooms and dorms, which are furnished with basic amenities and facilities, such as the fan, the locker, and the shared bathroom. You can also enjoy some free and convenient services, such as the breakfast, the Wi-Fi, and the laundry. You can also enjoy some social and fun activities, such as the rooftop party, the movie night, and the city tour.

Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park is a wonderful and unforgettable attraction that you should not miss when you visit Kuala Lumpur. It is a place where you can see and learn about thousands of butterflies and other insects, as well as enjoy the natural beauty and tranquility of the park. It is a place where you can have a fun and educational day with your family, friends, or partner, and create some unforgettable memories. We hope that this article has given you some useful and interesting information about Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park, and that you will visit it soon. Thank you for reading, and have a magical day!

Do you have any questions or comments about Kuala Lumpur Butterfly Park or this article? If so, please feel free to leave them below. We would love to hear from you and help you with your travel plans.
